Package silverlib.math.graph

Class TrigFunc

  • java.lang.Object
    • silverlib.math.graph.Function
      • silverlib.math.graph.TrigFunc

  • public class TrigFunc
extends Function
    A representation of a trigonometric function in a 2D coordinate plane
    Since:
    1.9.1.2
    Author:
    Jake Trimble

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String TRIG_REGEXP
      The Regular Expression to match for creating a function from a String {@value "y=(\\d*)(sin|cos|tan|sec|csc|cot)\\((\\d*)x([\\+-])?(\\d*)\\)([\\+-])?(\\d*)"}

    • Field Detail

      • TRIG_REGEXP

        public static java.lang.String TRIG_REGEXP
        The Regular Expression to match for creating a function from a String {@value "y=(\\d*)(sin|cos|tan|sec|csc|cot)\\((\\d*)x([\\+-])?(\\d*)\\)([\\+-])?(\\d*)"}

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrigFunc

        public TrigFunc​(double a,
                java.lang.String t,
                double k,
                double h,
                double v)
        Initializes a TrigFunc given numerical values
        Parameters:
        a - The amplitude of the trigonometric function
        t - The trigonometric function to use
        k - 2π over the period of the trigonometric function
        h - The horizontal translation of the trigonometric function
        v - The vertical translation of the trigonometric function
        Since:
        1.9.1.2

    • Method Detail

      • parseFunction

        public static TrigFunc parseFunction​(java.lang.String f)
                              throws FunctionFormatException
        Creates a TrigFunc from a trigonometric representation
        Parameters:
        f - The function as text conforming to RegExp TRIG_REGEXP
        Returns:
        An initialized TrigFunc
        Throws:
        FunctionFormatException - If f does not match the proper RegExp
        Since:
        1.9.1.2
